content:
That's a great plan! Your county's website is a excellent place to start, and it's likely to have the most up-to-date and specific information about the zoning regulations and building codes in your area.

It's also excellent that you have a lawyer who specializes in property law who can provide guidance and recommendations. They can help you navigate the complexities of the zoning regulations and building codes, and ensure that you're in compliance with all the necessary laws and regulations.

Additionally, your lawyer can also help you with other important aspects of building on your rural property, such as:

* Reviewing your property deed and ensuring that you have the necessary rights and permissions to build on the land
* Advising you on any easements or restrictions that may affect your building plans
* Helping you to negotiate with local authorities or neighbors if any issues arise during the permitting process
* Ensuring that you're in compliance with any environmental regulations or laws that may apply to your property

By working with your lawyer and doing your own research, you'll be well-prepared to navigate the permitting process and ensure that your cabin is built to code and in compliance with all relevant laws and regulations.

Remember to also take notes and keep records of all your interactions with local authorities, lawyers, and other professionals involved in the process. This will help you to keep track of progress, and ensure that you have a clear paper trail in case of any disputes or issues that may arise in the future.
